result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob C. KAUFMANN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Plea date set for 11-20-15 at 10:30 a.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.    
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.   Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 09-03-15 at 2:15 p.m.   Plea date is set for 11-20-15 at 10:30 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-06-15 at 2:30 p.m.

Authorization to Appear and Act; Notice of Motion and Motion for Discovery and Inspection; Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.

Court reviews defendant's financial status and finds he is above the poverty guidelines.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-29-15 at 2:30 p.m.  
Notice.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-22-15 at 2:30 p.m.
